intro: Rosa coruscans, commonly known as the sparkling rose, is a species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its striking, silvery-white petals that reflect light like a shimmering surface. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, producing a delightful fragrance. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, Rosa coruscans is often cultivated in specialized gardens.
